keyTakeAways: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro is set to release a memoir titled 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service' on January 27, 2025.
The memoir details his political journey, family life, faith, and the traumatic experience of his home being set on fire in April 2024.
The arson incident occurred while Shapiro and his family were sleeping, after a Passover gathering, and the suspect, Cody Balmer, pleaded guilty and was sentenced to 25 to 50 years in prison.
Shapiro has gained national prominence as a Democrat, being considered a potential running mate for Kamala Harris in the 2024 election and a potential 2028 presidential candidate.
HarperCollins Publishers, through its Harper imprint, announced the book, highlighting Shapiro’s personal and public service narratives as a core theme.
The book reflects on themes of community service, resilience, faith, and leadership in the face of adversity.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro is set to release his memoir, 'Where We Keep the Light: Stories From a Life of Service,' on January 27, 2025, through Harper, an imprint of HarperCollins Publishers. The book chronicles his political rise, personal faith, family life, and the traumatic 2024 arson attack on his home during a Passover gathering. The incident, involving suspect Cody Balmer who pleaded guilty and received a 25 to 50-year prison sentence, underscores the personal and public challenges Shapiro has faced. Shapiro, a prominent national Democrat, was considered a potential running mate for Kamala Harris in 2024 and is now seen as a possible 2028 presidential candidate. The memoir positions Shapiro as a leader who overcomes adversity through service and resilience, appealing to both personal and political audiences beyond Pennsylvania.
title: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro to Release Memoir on Personal Trauma and Public Service
